title: Seaborn Introduction
subject: Data Science
theory: Seaborn is built on top of Matplotlib. It provides a high-level interface for drawing attractive statistical graphics and works natively with Pandas DataFrames.
syntax:
import seaborn as sns
sns.scatterplot(data=df, x='age', y='salary')

examples.explanation: KDE (Kernel Density Estimate) smooths the histogram.

real_world_use_cases.description: Using `sns.pairplot(df)` to visualize relationships between ALL variables in one line of code.

summary: Seaborn makes complex plots simple and beautiful by default.
